data.title: Correct duplicate vertices issue when Intersect polygons share points.
data.body: Addresses Issue  [#3804.](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3804)

data.title: Gdx2DPixmap.setPixel() actually performs drawing pixel, not setting it, Also doing it wrong.
Clean up performance in VBOWithVAO and supply performance test
data.body:
- Adds attribute location caching
- Removes unnecessary gl calls

Performance test shows this change results in a ~95% decrease in total time taken to render a mesh with the VBOWithVAO VertexDataType.

Related issues: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3593

data.title: fixing #3914
data.body: Fixing ETC1.encodeImagePKM crash due to the null Gdx.app https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3914

data.title: ETC1.encodeImagePKM crashes due to the null Gdx.app
FreeTypeFontGenerator-texture-bleeding-#3521-fix
data.body:
Fixing https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3521
- `PixmapPacker` has a new parameter `Color currentTransparentColor;` used by `Page` constructor to fill transparent pixels.
- `FreeTypeFontGenerator` sets packer to use color of the font but with zero alpha for transparent pixels to avoid leaks.

data.title: Sudden CPU spike when VertexArray reaches a certain size (1040)
ETC1.encodeImagePKM() produces broken image
data.body:
I suppose the following section:

```
Pixmap pixmap = new Pixmap(Gdx.files.absolute("image.png"));
ETC1.encodeImagePKM(pixmap).write(Gdx.files.absolute("image.etc1"));
```

in the doc https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Texture-Compression

should be replaced with the working
`ETC1Compressor.process(input_folder, output_folder, false, true);`

    x28  00000000000009c4  x29  0000007f97d66f10  x30  0000007fa34dd508
    sp   0000007f97d66f10  pc   0000007fa34dbdcc  pstate 0000000020000000
backtrace:
    #00 pc 00000000002bcdcc  /system/vendor/lib64/egl/libGLESv2_adreno.so (A4xBltDevice::A4xBltMacroTileGeneral(unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, BltExecSwCopy*)+76)

Is it the same issue?

Can anyone help me out with that?

Thank you in advance!!!

data.title: +ETC1 Atlas Compressor
data.body:
Back-story: https://twitter.com/badlogicgames/status/643082568334745600

`ETC1AtlasCompressor` takes atlas produced by the `TexturePacker` and converts it to `ETC1` format by:
- compressing textures from `PNG` to `ETC1`,
- changing texture-file names accordingly in the atlas description file.

To test the `ETC1AtlasCompressor` please run the `ETC1AtlasCompressorTest`, the test will:
- prepare example atlas using sprites in the sprites folder,
- compress the atlas,
- load and render compressed sprites on the screen using gdx desktop backend.

data.title: ObjectMap copy ctor broken as of libgdx 1.7.2
+ETC1 Atlas Compressor
data.body:
Back-story: https://twitter.com/badlogicgames/status/643082568334745600

`AtlasETC1Compressor` takes atlas produced by the `TexturePacker` and converts it to `ETC1` format by:
- compressing textures from `PNG` to `ETC1`,
- changing texture-file names accordingly  in the atlas description file.

To test the `AtlasETC1Compressor` please run the `AtlasETC1CompressorTest`, the test will:
- prepare example atlas using sprites in the sprites folder,
- compress the atlas using `AtlasETC1Compressor`,
- load and render compressed sprites on the screen using gdx desktop backend.

data.title: JARs import proposal
data.body:
When I import freshly downloaded gdx projects from the repository, they all are "red" because of missing jars:
![gdx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1580663/13576449/0af2bed0-e48e-11e5-85c3-fe353021b07d.jpg)

I know the documentation says that I have to download the missing jars from the gdx-nightly server and manually re-import them (which btw is not very handy).

I would like to propose (I believe) a better solution that I already successfully use for the JAR's import.

The idea is that:
1) You create a new repository and call it **gdx-nightly**.
2) There you upload an eclipse project that contains all the jars. Here is an example: https://github.com/JFixby/libgdx-nightly
3) Then you import that project into eclipse workspace and link the jars.

That would be a solution for the Eclipse.

Now when you import freshly downloaded gdx projects from the repository, they will all immediately resolve the missing jars right when you import the **gdx-nightly** into your workspace. 

Pros:
- no manual resolution, just import the **gdx-nightly**
- you can deduce related paragraph in the doc to simple "just import the **gdx-nightly**"
- bonus: you can use git to switch libraries between versions to test you code against older jars

data.title: StringBuilder.toString() does not work in GWT with large strings using the LibGDX StringBuilder
data.body:
#### Issue details

`StringBuilder.toString()` does not work in GWT with large strings when using the LibGDX `StringBuilder`. There is a known bug in the `String` constructor in GWT when working with large strings which I've worked around in the past in my own code. See [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32844235/new-stringbytes-causing-maximum-call-stack-size-exceeded-in-gwt-client). I'm hitting this problem when creating JSON from a large object.
#### Reproduction steps/code

The following code will reproduce the issue. This works fine with the Java String Builder

```
    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
    for (int i = 1; i < 100000; i++) {
        sb.append("Hello!");
    }
    String s = sb.toString();
```
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

All
#### Stacktrace

```
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException: (RangeError) 
 __gwt$exception: <skipped>: Maximum call stack size exceeded
at Unknown.__valueOf(html-0.js@30:197503)
at Unknown.valueOf_100(html-0.js@10:197712)
at Unknown._String_3(html-0.js@10:197468)
at Unknown.$toString_12(html-0.js@10:63725)
at Unknown.$prettyPrint_2(html-0.js@10:58593)
at Unknown.$prettyPrint_4(html-0.js@10:58679)
at Unknown.$prettyPrint_1(html-0.js@10:46957)
at Unknown.$prettyPrint_0(html-0.js@10:46953)
at Unknown.$prettyPrint(html-0.js@10:46949)
at Unknown.getString_4(html-0.js@25:203579)
at Unknown.$saveUser(html-0.js@43:182979)
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] HTML/GWT

data.title: Adding ControllerListener doesn't return
data.body:
#### Issue details

When the method `Controllers.addListener` is called when a controller is connected then it doesn't return. It looks like the `initialize` method isn't returning because it doesn't print out that mangers are added to the application. Furthermore I think this issue comes with a new Windows 10 Build because it worked perfectly before Windows updated itself (Also 3 Microsoft Joysticks are registered even if there is no controller connected, wasn't like that before) 
#### Reproduction steps/code

`public class ControllerTest extends ApplicationAdapter implements ControllerListener
{
    @Override
    public void create()
    {
        Controllers.addListener(this);
    }
    ...
}`
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

libGDX 1.9.2 and libGDX 1.9.3 SNAPSHOT
Tested with a Xbox One Controller wired/wireless
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS
#### Edit

Looks like the new Windows 10 Build broke the Xbox One Controller Driver : http://www.infoworld.com/article/3040403/microsoft-windows/bad-windows-10-xbox-one-controller-forces-microsofts-hand.html
Futhermore FIFA 16 also got problems with it ;)
I don't know if should close this issue?!

data.title: LibGDX's Android Keyboard input not working with the "Samsung Keyboard"
data.body:
#### Issue details

On Samsung's keyboard, there is a glitch where it does not process the command InputType.NULL sent by the Android App and therefore shows predictive text above the keyboard, which breaks LibGDX's keyboard input. 

I think this may be temporarily fixed if we can modify the InputType of the on screen keyboard. This would allow us to set the keyboard's input type as a visible password, which would prevent predictive text appearing.

I know this is not necessarily an issue with LibGDX, it is more Samsung's issue. It was reported to [Samsung a while ago ](http://developer.samsung.com/forum/board/thread/view.do?boardName=General&messageId=281092&frm=7&tagValue=keyboardbug&curPage=1)but I don't think they will be fixing it anytime soon.
#### Reproduction steps/code

Create a game that uses an InputProcessor to receive keyboard input.

Load the game on a Samsung Galaxy S5, S6, S6 Edge or Note 5 that uses the Samsung Keyboard app. Make sure predictive text is enabled on the keyboard settings.

Try to type something and no input will be registered.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

_Please provide the version(s) affected._
I have only tested with 1.6 and 1.9.3
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Fix selection of non latin characters

Previously it was impossible to select "" as a whole word.
You were only able to select one of those characters.
@NathanSweet

data.title: [Feature Request] Add the ability to determine if the onscreen keyboard is currently visible. (Possible events?)
data.body:
Currently if a fullscreen table is used, it's hard to offset the contents when an onscreen keyboard shows up, as there isn't a way of knowing whether it is there or not.

If a way to determine if it's there or not was added, or even possible onKeyboardShow, and onKeyboardHide, it'd allow this to be done.

data.title: Robovm Music class problem
data.body:
#### Issue details

(The following applies to both iOS simulator and actual device, both on iOS 9)

I'm porting an Android project to iOS using RoboVM.

(Almost) Everything works fine except of Music. I'm using .mp3 files. Whenever I try to create a Music object using Audio.newMusic, the following fatal error appears:

com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Error opening music file at ...
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSAudio.newMusic(IOSAudio.java)

I even tried to load a mp3 file that works right when loaded with the Sound class, but it doesn't work either. So I guess there's a difference between Sound and Music classes on how they load the files.

UPDATE: I've just tried with .wav, .ogg, .mp4 and .mp3 with different bitrates and all throw the same error.

**IMPORTANT: I just discovered that actually the problem is the Internal storage, Sounds doesn't actually work when loaded from there, but they don't throw a Fatal Error, just the following error:

IOSLauncher[1160:26466] OAL Error: -[OALSimpleAudio internalPreloadEffect:reduceToMono:]: Could not load effect /Users/fedejm/Library/Developer/CoreSimulator/Devices/C185A369-7580-4E5E-8698-2C99D9DAA53F/data/Containers/Bundle/Application/563DAF14-D4E1-4638-9D58-2695765531C4/IOSLauncher.app/data/sounds/togglepowerup.mp3

Both Music and Sound load and play correctly when loaded from Local storage. It seems I should find a workaround.**
#### Reproduction steps/code

These are the two files I tried:
[sounds.zip](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/150226/sounds.zip)

The following code gives error:
Gdx.audio.newMusic(Gdx.files.internal("data/themes/"+theme+"/food.mp3"));

The following code works:
Gdx.audio.newSound(Gdx.files.internal("data/themes/"+theme+"/food.mp3"));
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

Just used Libgdx installer 2 days ago, so lastest stable version. 1.12 RoboVM that came with it.
#### Stacktrace

``` java
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Error opening music file at /Users/fedejm/Library/Developer/CoreSimulator/Devices/C185A369-7580-4E5E-8698-2C99D9DAA53F/data/Containers/Bundle/Application/41812F6A-BBAD-43AF-B1E3-73CD7641FED2/IOSLauncher.app/data/themes/clownfish/bg.mp3
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSAudio.newMusic(IOSAudio.java:67)
    at com.me.eatthelinetwo.Screenplay.addBackground(Screenplay.java:2360)
    at com.me.eatthelinetwo.Screenplay.resetGame(Screenplay.java:976)
    at com.me.eatthelinetwo.Screenplay.show(Screenplay.java:927)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.Game.setScreen(Game.java:61)
    at com.me.eatthelinetwo.EatTheLine.create(EatTheLine.java:31)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics.draw(IOSGraphics.java:307)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics$1.draw(IOSGraphics.java:209)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics$1.$cb$drawRect$(IOSGraphics.java)
    at org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication.main(Native Method)
    at org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication.main(UIApplication.java:413)
    at com.me.eatthelinetwo.IOSLauncher.main(IOSLauncher.java:30)
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] iOS

data.title: Controller disconnect crashes with LWJGL3
data.body:
#### Issue details

When disconnecting a controller, while the game is running, crashing occurs.
#### Reproduction steps/code
- Enable LWJGL3
- Connect at least one gamepad
- Call Controllers.getControllers() within your Application to initialize
- Disconnect the controller
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

LibGDX 1.9.2 on Windows 10. Using a MS wireless receiver and Xbox 360 controller.
#### Stack trace

http://pastebin.com/1TmNmbLH
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS
